entry.title: “Actually, It Wasn't Magic” (“It Was Just You, Uther.”)
entry.summary:
Author: NeutralMime

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 43,240Chapters: 15/?Kudos: 250

Summary: Starting with Valiant, Arthur begins to realize that maybe—just maybe—Camelot’s problems aren’t caused by magic alone, no matter what his father’s been screaming his whole life.Instead, it’s a mess of emotional tangles, terrible communication, and the dawning horror that Uther might be completely wrong about… well, everything.

entry.title: The Once and Future Professor
entry.summary:
Author: Buffoonery

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 22,086Chapters: 11/21Kudos: 67

Summary: Professor Emeric Ambrose is Hogwarts' new Muggle Studies teacher. His qualifications include a deep, personal animosity towards every major author of the Arthurian legends, an unnerving ability to reason with sentient furniture, and the eyes of a man who has been tired for a very, very long time.He's also Merlin.All he wants is a quiet life. But with a king in a painting who won't stop giving bad advice, a magical portrait of his nemesis down the hall, and two red-headed apprentices who are determined to learn the art of "narrative chaos," Merlin is about to discover that the only thing worse than being forgotten by history is having it come back to haunt you. Literally.

entry.title: albion's greatest need is finally here (and merlin is fucking ecstatic)
entry.summary:
Author: Benji (DqrrenSentimarLives)

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 116,280Chapters: 14/?Kudos: 26

Summary: Merlin has waited too long. Lived too many lives. Now, as the reclusive Doctor Emrys, a world-renowned expert, his skills are desperately needed against a terrifying new pandemic. Trapped within the sterile walls of a high-security lab, reeling from the virus's impossible nature and the sudden appearance of hauntingly familiar faces, the last thing he expects is for the chaos to deliver the one soul he never stopped loving... back from the depths of legend.

entry.title: When Hope Withers
entry.summary:
Author: Trialbyname

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 10,493Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 18

Summary: “𝘈𝘳𝘵𝘩𝘶𝘳, 𝘨𝘦𝘵 𝘣𝘢𝘤𝘬!”No… he had been in it.“𝘔𝘦𝘳𝘭𝘪𝘯? 𝘞𝘩𝘢𝘵 𝘪𝘴 𝘵𝘩𝘢𝘵?”He had been in it. He was sure of that.“𝘔𝘰𝘳𝘨𝘢𝘯𝘢, 𝘺𝘰𝘶 𝘮𝘶𝘴𝘵 𝘬𝘯𝘰𝘸 𝘵𝘩𝘢𝘵 𝘺𝘰𝘶 𝘤𝘢𝘯𝘯𝘰𝘵 𝘥𝘦𝘧𝘦𝘢𝘵 𝘮𝘦.”And he had not been alone.“𝘐 𝘥𝘰 𝘯𝘰𝘵 𝘯𝘦𝘦𝘥 𝘵𝘰 𝘥𝘦𝘧𝘦𝘢𝘵 𝘺𝘰𝘶, 𝘌𝘮𝘳𝘺𝘴-”His hand flew up to his neck, almost by instinct. But there was nothing there.What… what had happened in that hovel?

entry.title: Lancelot
entry.summary:
Author: pendr_gon

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,664Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 2

Summary: Lancelot arrives in Camelot, and Merlin seems different around him. Arthur is entirely neutral about this, unbothered in fact, and not at all jealous or forlorn — in fact, he's barely noticed at all. Is he crying himself to sleep? Perhaps. Has that got anything to do with the fact his manservant is spending a lot of time with a handsome, dark-haired, olive-skinned man? Absolutely not.

entry.title: Don't be suspicious
entry.summary:
Author: Lady_Mustard77

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,948Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 10

Summary: Then he heard voices. Muffled and hushed, but Merlin would recognize those voices anywhere. The door to a room at the end of the corridor was slightly ajar, and beyond it, he could hear Leon, Percival, Elyan, and Lancelot talking. He couldn’t make out much, but a few fragmented phrases filtered through the gap:“Totally gonna fail,”“Too much at stake,”“They can’t find out,”“Just act normal,”Merlin blinked. What couldn’t they find out? And what was at stake?His mind immediately jumped to treason. Or an assassination plot. Or maybe an underground fight ring. Were the knights gambling again?---or Merlin overhears something and spirals

entry.title: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Time
entry.summary:
Author: HarmonyOfTheSpheres

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 17,890Chapters: 5/21Kudos: 154

Summary: Merlin has returned to Hogwarts for his second year as the History of Magic professor, and this time he is determined to find a way to destroy the horcrux within Harry before it's too late. It's not exactly a simple task, however, especially with an escaped convict on the loose and dementors lurking around Hogwarts' grounds. So when Merlin finally gets a chance to change Harry's fate, he takes it.A bit of time travel is surely worth the risk if it will save Harry's life—isn't it?

entry.title: Fate/Absolute Fake [ENG]
entry.summary:
Author: Sesaria_Herluna

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 35,791Chapters: 15/?Kudos: 6

Summary: In Harry’s sixth year, Snape delivers troubling news to the Order of the Phoenix: someone has gifted the Dark Lord with an ancient grimoire, one that speaks of an impending Holy Grail War. The prize for the victor? The universal wish-granting device known as the Holy Grail.Snape brings a copy of the text. Alarmed, the Order decides they too must enter the war. Both factions choose their candidates, waiting for the Command Spells to appear before summoning their Servants. The Holy Grail War begins.And Merlin, having foreseen the incineration of the world, once again steps onto the stage of history.Master–Servant Pairs:Saber — Arthur Pendragon | Master: Harry PotterArcher — Pikoi-a-ka-Alala | Master: Dolores UmbridgeLancer — Loki (Albus Dumbledore) | Master: Severus SnapeRider — Kilgharrah | Master: MerlinCaster — Tom Riddle / Lord Voldemort | Master: Morgan FayeAssassin — La Llorona | Master: Amos DiggoryBerserker — Harry Potter [Alter] | Master: Lord VoldemortExtra:Alter Ego — Nimueh (?) | Master: Apostle of the Foreign GodIf you're not familiar with some of the canons, it's fine. I tried to make it easy to read for everyone.

entry.title: For the Love of Dragons
entry.summary:
Author: Ginkgo_Biloba_Baggins

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 8,057Chapters: 3/5Kudos: 275

Summary: Arthur is relieved when Balinor the Dragonlord agrees to help, but dismayed when he refuses to come back to Camelot. Instead, Arthur is stuck waiting in the middle of nowhere while Balinor calls the dragon. To make matters worse, Arthur’s idiot manservant clearly has a massive crush on the guy: despite him being a grumpy, straggly, cave-dwelling sorcerer, who makes terrible cabbage pottage, Merlin hasn’t taken his eyes off him! Arthur will tolerate this nonsense for a couple of days, but only because he must save Camelot.

entry.title: Beneath the Surface
entry.summary:
Author: BlueGrassSax

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 174,562Chapters: 54/54Kudos: 749

Summary: Camelot is a lot bigger than the letter suggested it to be.The buildings here tower at three stories tall, sometimes even four, and that’s only in the lower town. The battlements alone leave trailing shadows over the roads, the stone and brick laid down who-knows how long ago.Merlin clutches Gaius’ letter close, looking down every now and then to recheck the directions. The roads are winding and narrow with more than a few dead-ends.His offer hangs just under the directions:"Mentor under me and I can teach you the control you seek – a physician’s apprentice is a noble trade not many young men have the opportunity to undertake. Do you understand?"Merlin didn’t understand at first, not until Hunith pressed a set of Will’s old clothes into confused hands. As tough as it is for a sheltered boy to saunter into a new city to take a position under an esteemed healer – not even considering the illegalities of the implied additional tutelage – it would be an impossibility for even the most headstrong of women.
